thread.title: Sunderland transfer news: Nedum Onuoha a target as David Moyes eyes swoop for QPR defender and Celtic target
thread.title_full: Sunderland transfer news: Nedum Onuoha a target as David Moyes eyes swoop for QPR defender and Celtic target

author: ashilton
title: Sunderland transfer news: Nedum Onuoha a target as David Moyes eyes swoop for QPR defender and Celtic target
text:
EFL On the money Sunderland transfer news: Nedum Onuoha a target as David Moyes eyes swoop for QPR defender and Celtic target 
Moyes could face competition from Bhoys as he desperately looks to bolster the back-line of his rock-bottom team Gossip Comments DAVID MOYES is considering a swoop for Nedum Onuoha. 
According to the Telegraph , Moyes is eyeing the 30-year-old QPR defender who spent the 2010-11 season on loan with the Wearsiders. Getty Images 5 Nedum Onuoha is believed to be a target for Sunderland boss David Moyes 
Moyes has already conceded that he will be conducting his transfer dealings on a shoestring budget this month. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Sunderland news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Onuoha has a deal at Loftus Road until the summer of 2018 and is unlikely to command a big fee. 
But money is so tight at Sunderland that Moyes may still not be able to stump up the wages required. Reuters Onuoha (left) has made 29 appearances for the Hoops this season Reuters David Moyes has admitted is ‘limited with a capital L’ this month 
Celtic are also thought to be keen and Brendan Rodgers could yet provide Moyes with competition. 
But the Aston Villa flop is unlikely to be up to speed any time soon, leaving Moyes still likely to be short of a centre-back. PA:Press Association Aston Villa failure Joleon Lescott has arrived to bolster Moyes’ back-line Reuters 5 But Patrick van Aanholt looks set to seal a £12m move to Crystal Palace 
Lamine Kone is poised to return after Ivory Coast were knocked out of the Africa Cup of Nations. 
Djilobodji denies a violent conduct charge and is set to discover his fate. Related stories West Ham join Burnley and Middlesbrough in £10million chase for Robert Snodgrass Roo oldie Wayne Rooney has the body of a 40-YEAR-OLD after years of pressure and scrutiny, claims pal Rio Ferdinand Transfers live All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window 'I knew there would be serious consequences' Spurs legend Gary Mabbutt, who fractured his skull in 1993, warns Ryan Mason not to rush back from sickening clash... even though he'll want to BLUE MOVE Chelsea ace Branislav Ivanovic ready to snub Everton, Leicester and West Ham for big-money move to Zenit Chu-Bru Reunion Arsenal striker Chuba Akpom is a six-month loan target for Aston Villa boss Steve Bruce rio grand Rio Ferdinand gets close to TOWIE star Kate Wright two years after family heartache - here's everything we know AXEL RISE Jose Mourinho reveals sale of two players could open up first team chance for academy star Axel Tuanzebe SINKING SWANS Swansea may have beaten Liverpool but history suggests they're on to a loser mitch the boat Ajax left-back Mitchell Dijks snubs £3m switch to Norwich as he looks for Premier League move BEE IN BONNET Former Chelsea starlet Josh McEachran was chased by Madrid at 16 - but now he faces Blues with Brentford Karank-ing it up PSG and Ex-Real Madrid star Jese set to join Aitor Karanka's Middlesbrough in sensational switch Wembley awaits When is the EFL Cup final 2017? Latest odds, ticket info and TV coverage - here's what we know SLAVEN B-ILL-IC Hammers boss in hospital with flu he may have caught off Michail Antonio semi delay Why Manchester United are playing their EFL Cup semi-final second-leg against Hull City on a Thursday STAY ON YOUR FEET Arsene Wenger says he will ban Granit Xhaka from tackling but supports his man over racism accusation Nou deal, same story Liverpool could still lose Philippe Coutinho to Barcelona despite new contract as they plot mega-bid on my ped, son Chelsea 'make offer that can't be refused' for Brazilian wonderkid Pedrinho WORK OF ART Arturo Vidal already learning English as Chelsea boss Antonio Conte launches £56m summer move 
Moyes could be handed a cash boost if Patrick van Aanholt completes his £12m move to Crystal Palace . 
But the Sunderland are only to the Eagles about a deal after Dutch left-back Van Aanholt told them he wanted out. 
Sunderland are currently rock-bottom in the Prem and three points from safety Adnan Januzaj reveals his training methods at Sunderland
